title: Basic usage
text: tutorial use several packages besides ember. packages available installing ember.

title: Basic usage
text: first step ember get samples embedded common space molecular samples. can plot ABiM samples top available samples TCGA, METABRIC SCAN-B November 2023. First need normalize data using function get_final_raking_values. embedding obtained using “small” version embedding using 1044 genes. method robust missing genes, 1044 genes available can still use . Given dataset arguments one needs change sum_exp assay_to_use arguments. sum_exp corresponds dataset SummarizedExperiment object assay_to_use corresponds slot SummarizedExperiment object normalized data saved. package internally uses assay(sum_exp, assay_to_use) fetch data. See SummarizedExperiment package information data type2. plot shows ABIM samples common space. place expected. color code PAM50 obtained Prosigna.  can see close cohorts space batch effects.  Makes sense since ABiM Swedish cohort obtained similar way SCAN-B.
code: # first calculate the normalization. by default it uses the  # small PCA model abim_100_normalized <- ember::get_final_ranking_values(     sum_exp = abim_100, assay_to_use = "log2fpkm",      most_variable_genes = "small" ) #> Total number of stable genes: 44 #> Total number of genes: 1044 #> Number of samples: 100  # calculate the embedding for the abim abim_100_normalized <- ember::get_pca_coordinates(     abim_100_normalized, which_pca = "small" )   # get now the base plot so we can overlay the samples into the  # embedding base_plot <- ember::get_base_plot()  # plot on top of the base plot to have an idea where the samples p <- base_plot +      ggplot2::geom_point(         colData(abim_100_normalized) %>%             data.frame,         mapping = aes(x = PC3, y = PC4, color = pam50),         size = 5,         alpha = 1,         shape = 17     ) p base_plot_batch <- ember::get_base_plot(     x = "PC1",      y = "PC2",     color = "cohort" )  # plot on top of the base plot to have an idea where the samples p_batch <- base_plot_batch +      ggplot2::geom_point(         colData(abim_100_normalized) %>%             data.frame,         mapping = aes(x = PC1, y = PC2),         color = "black",         size = 3,         alpha = 1,         shape = 17     )  p_batch

title: Basic usage
text: section can explain can ember calculate scores samples individually first calculating position common space genes (8253) regressing batch effects first two components. way can compare scores across different cohorts even. now use two functions get_regressed_data first calculate normalized regressed dataset containing end 8253 genes (available) followed get_scores_regressed calculate scores 50 Hallmark pathways Molecular Signature Database (MSigDB). function get_gene_sets using msigdbr function hood fetch datasets prepares object used get_scores_regressed. functions get_regressed_data get_scores_regressed return SummarizedExperiment objects, can use usual functions SummarizedExperiment package fetch metadata normalized regressed data (saved slot regressed). 50 new columns names “regressed_” name pathway metadata. Moreover, one can also check regressed gene expression levels checking assay “regressed”.  bimodal distribution expected. Lower levels associated Estrogen Receptor (ER) negative tumors high levels ER+.
code: # we first get the gene sets to calculate the scores gene_sets <- ember::get_gene_sets(species = "Homo sapiens", category = "H")  abim_100_regressed <- ember::get_regressed_data(     sum_exp = abim_100, assay_to_use = "log2fpkm" ) %>%     # calculate the scores for the regressed data     ember::get_scores_regressed(sum_exp = ., gene_sets = gene_sets) #> Total number of stable genes: 44 #> Total number of genes: 8253 #> Number of samples: 100 #> [1] "Normalization done." genes_of_interest <- c("ESR1", "TFF1")  SummarizedExperiment::assay(abim_100_regressed, "regressed")[     genes_of_interest,  ] %>%      t %>%     data.frame %>%     ggplot2::ggplot(aes(x = ESR1)) +     ggplot2::geom_histogram(bins = 20) +      ggplot2::labs(         y = "Count",          title = "Distribution of ESR1\nregressed expression levels"     ) +      ggplot2::theme_bw(base_size = 20)

title: Basic usage
text: can now compare different conditions based pathway scores obtained previously. validation step, compare estrogen receptor signaling signature (HALLMARK_ESTROGEN_RESPONSE_EARLY) ER IHC positive negative tumors. expect see big differences two subtypes.  able see distinctions expected.
code: colData(abim_100_regressed) %>%     data.frame %>%     dplyr::filter(!is.na(ER)) %>%     ggplot2::ggplot(aes(         x = ER,          y = regressed_HALLMARK_ESTROGEN_RESPONSE_EARLY,         color = ER     )) +      ggplot2::geom_jitter(show.legend = FALSE) +      ggplot2::geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.5, outlier.shape = NA, show.legend = FALSE) +      ggplot2::labs(         x = "ER IHC",          y = "Estrogen early",         title = "Scores calculated on\nregressed data"     ) +      ggplot2::theme_bw(base_size = 15)

title: Get regressed data — get_regressed_data
text: sum_exp Summarized experiment object. contain "rank" slot used calculate average rank stable genes. assay_to_use string. assay use calculating average expression stable genes. which_pca string stating PCA object use get coordinates. Two options available: "small" "big". "small" option uses fit 1044 genes. "big" option uses one 8000+ genes, used regression data. stable_genes vector. list 44 genes used qPCR-like normalization NULL (default). remove_components vector principal components removed. Default PC1, PC2 PC5
